item.description:
Let's hike Foster's Pond in Windham NH.  I don't believe this group has ever hiked this trail, so it should be an adventure. 

It's recommended that you wear hiking boots and bring bug spray, suntan lotion and plenty of liquids to keep hydrated.

About Foster's Pond:

The Foster's Pond Natural area was acquired for conservation purposes in 1985 and enlarged in 1996 by the acquisition of approximately 19.5 acres through a land exchange with an abutter.  This parcel now containing approximately 190 acres, is located in the Northwest corner of Windham off of Nashua Road, abutting the Nashua Road Recreation Complex and a former railroad bed, a part of the Rockingham Recreation trail maintained by the NH Department of Transportation.  Foster's Pond Natural Area contains two ponds, which are connected by Mill Brook, which is connected by Beaver Brook.

See Page 9 for Map:

http://www.windhamnewhampshire.com/updated/pdfs/WalkingInWindhamCompressed.pdf

Directions:

http://www.nemba.org/ridingzone/Fosters_Pond.html
item.how_to_find_us: I will wear a Meetup name tag.
item.name: FAN Hike: Foster's Pond
